story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Sublime Text - Download
caption: sublimetext.com
description: Sublime Text 2 may be downloaded and evaluated for free, however a license must be purchased for continued use. There is currently no enforced time limit for the evaluation.

data.message:
It's my main editor for a month now on Mac & PC. all i can say it's awesome!

http://net.tutsplus.com/tutorials/tools-and-tips/sublime-text-2-tips-and-tricks/

http://rathersplendid.net/home/customise-sublime-text-2
I use text mate on mac or VIM
Nothing beats Vim for me, but if I have to use a graphical text editor, I use gedit, Kate, or Npp on windows.
It's nearly the same as Textmate but more customizable but on Windows it's way better than Npp
I never used all of npp's features anyway :D I use IDEs more since I write Java code most of the time.

I love Vim! i started using it since a couple of Months and they have some crazy amazing Add-ons. one colleague posted his Configuration files on Git. It's awesome: https://github.com/edgarjs/vimfiles give it a shot :)
too bad it doesn't have a readme file, though :D
how about komodo, it's just released an open edition
